intro: Rinorea latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth surface and can grow up to 15 centimeters in length. Rinorea latibracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
